Entries.Text: Welcome to Camp!
Pretty cozy isn't it?
We'll be setting up camp in a lot of differenct places as we travel to save the world, so don't get too attached to this old cabin.
Now that we've got a moment, let's look at your PageBook.
Click the "Prepare" option so look at your Equipment.
On second thought. The Dev decided to completly redo PageBooks (after making the tutorial). So there is no tutorial now. We're done here.
This is your PageBook,
your interface to the Page System.
It has a lot of functions, but we should probably start with Party Inventory and Equipment.
This big empty box on the right is the Party Inventory.
It holds all the Items that have been picked up in your travels.
It  filters Items baseed on what is open on the left.
It would be showing Equipment right now, but you didn't pick up any new equipment since you can't wear squirrel armor.
On the left is your Equipment Slots.
You put Equipment here to make sure you're wearing them when you Spawn into the Page System.
You've got your slots for Head, Body, Feet, so on.
But, the most important slot is the one for your PageBook,
right here.
It's so important in fact, you physically can't close your PageBook if you don't have a PageBook equipt.
Give it a try!
Unequip your PageBook, then try to close the PageBook.
See?
It's like a law of the universe.
The only way to get rid of a PageBook is to equipt a new one.
Does this mean that every person who's every pickup a PageBook is physically required to carry one with them, at all times, for the rest of thier life?
Yes
But instead of thinking about that, let's look at what PageBook you have.
These handy Detail Cards come with every Item you find.
Let's see what it says about your PageBook...
Hmm...
Seems to be an old journal from your wandering days.
It's old,
but I'd say it still works.
More importantly, take a look at these:
This is your PPR, or Pages per Round, if you forgot.
And these are your Page Slots. They decide how many and what types of Pages you can equip.
You see, your PageBook controles what Pages you can take into combat, and the number of Pages you can use each Round.
In your case, you can use 4 Pages per Round.
And you can equip:
1 Bar Page,
1 Class Page,
and 6 of any type of Action Page.
Different Books can have very different numbers.
Spell Tomes have low PPR, but a lot of slots for Spells.
A Feild Manual could have high PPR, but fewer Page slots.
Or you might find a Travel Log with high PPR and extra lots just for Movement Pages.
That's why it's important to find the PageBook that's right for you!
But you only have one now, so deal with it.
Put your PageBook back on and we'll take a look at what Pages you have.
This is the Page page of your PageBook
page of your PageBook...
chapter of your
This is the Page chapter of your...
These are your Page Slots!
You probably recognize most of them as the things you just used to murder a bunch of squirrels,
but there a couple more that you couldn't see in combat.
Namely these, your Class Pages.
They provide passive Effects so long as you have them in a Page Slot.
Unlike Action Pages, which require a turn to execute, Class Pages are always active.
You don't need to do anything to use them, so they don't show up on your Page Bar while in combat.
I'd explain more here, but the Dev is still trying to decide how Classes will work, so there's no point writing the script right now.
Let's look at the Page you picked up from those squirrles.
Looks like you got a squirrel's Page for chuching acorns.
You can get Pages from a lot a different sources.
Like finding people who already have a copy and killing them.
Let's try equiping it.
Drag it over from the Party Inventory to your Page Slots.
Now you can Chuch Acorns just like the best of squirrels
but you can't Turn Right anymore
that was probably dumb.
But it's easy enough to switch back.
Ta-Da!
It should go without saying that the Pages you choose to take into combat have a huge effect on whether or not you come out of it alive.
Don't just focus on how much damage an attack might do.
Also keep in mind things like Energy Costs or Targeting Area and Type.
Well,
that's all I have to say.
There's probably a lot of stuff I forgot to mention, but to be honest,
I'm not use to talking this much.
These Flash Cards should cover the rest of it.
And so,
the Mysterious Figuer joined the Hero's Party.
Did you hear that?
With an optomistic smile on thier face, and the thrill of adventure in thier heart, our Hero was ready to fullfil thier destiny and save the world.
Who's talking?
It was then that they noticed the stranger sitting in there camp.
Who are you?
The stranger did not respond. Instead, they continued to write in the large book that sat upon thier lap.
We can hear you, you know?
They were a fine specimen of a man.
What?
As strong as an ox and as virile as a herd of wild stallions.
Please stop!
He stood six foot ten,
We can see you.
with the build of a great warrior,
Really!?
and a full head of hair.
This stranger was clearly a Scribe
Wait, did you say Scribe?
, and a magnificent one at that!
we do need a scribe
Recognizing the value of such a skilled Scribe, the Hero's party happy greated them and offered to share thier food.
The Scribe was very hungry as they had been locked in this cabin for many days hidding from the Squirrels.
Fine,
you can have some food.
But stop writing about how attractive you think you are.
And so,
the Scribe joined the Hero's Party.
joined the Hero's Party.
, who was clever and funny and really popular, and who had a really b-
STOP!
, who was clever and funny and really popular, and who had a really b-
joined the Hero's Party.
Now that we've got one, I might as well explain what a Scribe can do.
I'm tired of talking so I'll make this quick.
Scribes can "Save" and "Load" the state of the world.
I'm not going to pretend to know how it works, but it's basically time travel.
If every member of the Party dies inside the Page System,
everything reverts back to your last Save.
It can be pretty handy.
They can also "Quit" the world,
but I'm not supposed to know what that means.
Somehow our Hero could sense that the Scribe would unlock greater potential as thier journey continued.
I guess they're done eating.
Then let's have them make a new Save.
Just in case you run into something tougher than squirrels.
Not saving?
You like to live life dangeriously I see.
Well, we're finally done with the Tutorial.
When you're ready, hit "Quest" and meet  me to talk about our mission.
But give me a minute first,
I need to rest my voice...
